title: The Beacon
text: The background of this painting is based on a photograph that I took of the Peselli Hills in Pembrokeshire, Wales. It was taken on the evening of a Strawberry Moon which had just risen over the hills and had produced an eerie light. The navigation lights on the television mast which was situated in the hills added to the haunting atmosphere.....and then some man with a dog on his head and a puppy on his lap came cycling into the scene!

title: Android
text: This painting is based on a photo that I took of my granddaughter, Kiera. We were on a family holiday in Linton, Yorkshire, England, and we'd just finished a barbeque. It was twilight and Kiera had just borrowed her mom's Android mobile phone to play a game and I was captivated by the light.

title: Rest In Peace
text: This picture is based on the otherworldly setting of the Ffynone Falls in Pembrokeshire, Wales. There just happened to be a few people lying around sleeping at the tine. Or were they?

title: Ghost of Old Park Hill
text: I recently visited the iconic Park Hill flats in Sheffield, Yorkshire  England, which have now been refurbished. Whilst there the previous life of the building and its tenants was brought to mind. My painting depicts ghostly images of previous residents and their happy memories.

title: One For Sorrow
text: This drawing is of the trig point obelisk on top of Kinver Edge, Staffordshire, England. It depicts a misty Autumn day when the atmosphere was quite melancholic. A Magpie landed on top of the obelisk and I was reminded of the nursery rhyme  One for sorrow, two for joy.....

title: Death
text: This is my one & only acrylic painting. It is a painting of a dead tree in Chances Wood, Kinver, Staffordshire, England. I was taken with its majesty even in death.

title: It's a Halfpenny Green Moon
text: This is a portrait of a lovely lady, Emily. It is based on a photograph taken by her son which was posted on Facebook. I saw it and was taken by the sheer joy it exuded. I asked Emily if I could paint it and she kindly agreed. The photo was taken on an Autumn evening in front of a bonfire. The moon had just come out and Emily was drinking a pint of Halfpenny Green cider. She was very happy. Emily 1975 - 2026.

title: Big Boy
text: On a trip to Berlin we visited Templehof Airport. There are some hippy allotment gardens on there, the majority of which contain tat & rubbishy

installations. The desolation of the place moved me and I just had to take a photo of it. My son-in-law Sushil, struck a dramatic pose one day which I also felt was worthy of capturing. I thought the image of Templehof would make a good background for the drawing of Sushil.
